name: SS Corpro flight system
effect: Whenever this mech moves or boosts, it can fly.

name: Evasive Maneuvers
effect: In response to being hit by any ranged or melee attack, the mech can perform a barrel roll, flying 6 in any direction and causes the attack to miss. This movement does not provoke reactions and ignores engagement. The Ace must decide to take this reaction before damage is rolled, but after it knows the final result of the attack roll (hit, critical hit etc).

name: Bombing Bay
effect: When this mech moves or boosts and is flying, it can drop a bomb on one character below as a free action it that it passes over vertically or adjacent to. Bombs create a blast 1 area with at least 1 space on their target. All affected targets must pass an agility save or take 6/8/10 explosive damage and be knocked prone.

name: Strafe
effect: The Ace flies its speed in any direction in a strafing run, dealing 3/4/6 kinetic damage to any actor of its choice it passes over vertically or adjacent to (no roll required).

name: Missile Swarm
effect: This weapon does not hit allied characters and deals double damage to characters suffering from the Lock On condition

name: Watchful
effect: 1/round, in response to any hostile character moving in line of sight, the Ace can make the boost action as a reaction after that movement completes.

name: Chaff Launchers
effect: The Ace’s Evasive Maneuvers also work on tech attacks. In addition, after it takes its Evasive Manuevers action, it counts as being in soft cover until the end of its next turn.

name: Kai Bioplating
effect: This mech gains +1 Accuracy on all agility checks and saves. It can climb with no penalty, ignores difficult and dangerous terrain, and can jump half its speed vertically and its entire speed horizontally, in any combination.

name: Heated Blade
effect: This weapon deals double damage to targets suffering from the prone, shut down, shredded, immobilized, or stunned conditions.

name: Assassin's Mark
effect: The Assassin chooses a character in line of sight. For the rest of this scene, it has resistance to all damage from that target, its attacks are AP against that target, and it gains +2 accuracy on all saves from effects originating from that target. It can only change its target if its current target is destroyed.

name: Leap
effect: The Assassin flies 6 spaces in any direction but must end its move on a surface. Characters adjacent to it when it lands must pass an agility save or be knocked prone.

name: Sap
effect: A character adjacent to the Assassin must pass an engineering save or become stunned until the end of its next turn.

name: Spinning Kick
effect: A target adjacent to the Assassin must pass a hull save or be knocked back 4 spaces away from the Assassin and knocked prone.

name: Shroud Grenades
effect: The Assassin creates a burst 3 zone of soft cover around itself. The zone disperses at the end of its next turn, or when the Assassin creates a new one. Characters other than Assassins cannot trace line of sight into or out of the zone (characters at least partly inside the zone can draw line of sight to each other normally).

name: Explosive Knives
effect: A knife can be thrown at any character in range 3 as a quick action. Make a ranged attack roll for +2 vs evasion/tier, attaching on hit. At the end of the target’s next turn, the knife explodes, dealing 6/8/10 explosive damage in a burst 1 area centered on the knife or mech.

name: Brace
effect: The Assault gains resistance to all the damage from one attack that just hit it.

name: Micro-missile Barrage
effect: All characters in a line 8 area drawn from the Assault must pass a hull save or take 6/8/10 kinetic damage, or half on a successful save.

name: High Impact Rounds
effect: The Heavy Assault rifle can be fired with high caliber rounds, adding +4 kinetic damage and the AP tag, but requiring a reload after firing it this way (as if it had the loading tag).

name: Auto-targeting
effect: The Assault’s attacks ignore cover penalties (it must still obey line of sight).

name: Rank Discipline
effect: The Assault gains +1 Accuracy on all its attacks, checks, and saves as long as it’s adjacent to at least one friendly mech.

name: Chain Axe
effect: Critical hits from the Chain Axe cause targets damaged to become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Aggression
effect: The first time the Berserker takes damage each round, it must immediately make a Chain Axe attack as a reaction against a randomly determined adjacent target (allied or enemy).

name: Charge
effect: The Berserker moves its speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement, then makes a Chain Axe attack against a random character in range.

name: Molten Shield
effect: Once per round, the Berserker can activate this dispersal shield when it takes damage from any melee attack. The Berserker gains resistance to all the damage from the attack, and the attacker must pass an engineering save or take Burn 2/tier.

name: Juggernaut
effect: When the Berserker Charges, all characters (allied and enemy) it passes adjacent to during its Charge and all targets it ends adjacent to must pass a hull save or be knocked prone.

name: Harpoon
effect: Targets struck by this weapon the same size or smaller than the Berserker are pulled in a straight line adjacent to the Berserker or as far as possible. Otherwise, the Berserker is pulled towards the target. The Berserker then grapples the target automatically if it’s adjacent.

name: Nail Gun
effect: Targets struck by this weapon must pass an agility save or become immobilized until the end of their next turn.

name: Retribution
effect: When the Berserker takes damage, its next attack deals +2/3/4 bonus damage on hit. This effect stacks up to +8, but is lost after the Berserker makes any attack or at the end of the Berserker’s next turn.

name: Dual Shotguns
effect: The Breacher can attack twice with this weapon, choocking the same or different targets.

name: BREACH Ram
effect: The Breacher moves forward up to 6 spaces in a straight line as far as it can. It ignores engagement and can pass through, but not end its turn in, the space of other characters. Obstacles or objects such as cover in its path take 10 AP kinetic damage/tier. If an obstacle, wall, or piece of cover is destroyed, the Breacher passes through it and continues to pass through until it hits an obstacle it cannot destroy. All other characters passed through must pass an agility save or be pushed out of the Breacher’s path by the most direct route possible and knocked prone.

name: Break Armor
effect: A target struck more than twice by the Breacher’s Dual shotguns in the same turn becomes shredded for the rest of this scene.

name: Bring the Pain
effect: The Breacher chooses a character in range of its dual shotguns. It must be activated after the targeted character next round. At the start of the breacher’s next turn, if the target is still in range, the Breacher can attack that target twice with its dual shotguns (four times total) as a free action.

name: Superior Ram
effect: The Breacher’s BREACH Ram moves 10 spaces instead of 6 and characters hit make their agility save with 1 difficulty.

name: Hunter Lock
effect: On hit, all the Breacher’s attacks gain +1 accuracy/tier against that target, and 1/turn it can take the boost action as a Free Action, as long as it is made directly towards that target. The Breacher cannot change its target until it or the target is destroyed.

name: Thermal Charge
effect: Deals 3 Burn/tier. This weapon deals 10 AP kinetic damage/tier to walls, terrain, and deployables in the area.

name: Flechette Shot
effect: This attack creates a cone 3 area at its attack location, attacking all targets within.

name: Focus Down
effect: If the Scourer hit a character with the Thermal Lance that it already hit with the Thermal Lance in the previous turn, that character also takes burn 5/7/8.

name: Cooling Module
effect: If the scourer does not move (even involuntarily) between the end of its turn and start of its next turn, it reduces its heat to 0 at the start of its turn.

name: Ablative Shielding
effect: The Scourer has resistance to energy damage

name: Supercharged
effect: When the Scourer’s Focus Down trait activates, it’s target is also Shredded and Slowed until the end of its next turn.

name: Emergency Vent
effect: When the Scourer Overheats or becomes Shut Down, it immediately becomes invisible until the start of its next turn.

name: Pulse Laser
effect: This weapon can attack twice at tier III

name: Flash Lense
effect: The Scourer targets a cone 5 area in a direction of its choosing. All characters in the area must pass a systems save or be jammed until the start of the Scourer’s next turn.

name: Melt
effect: The Scourer targets an object or drone in range 10, then makes a ranged attack, dealing 20 AP energy damage on hit.
